concept.title: Telehealth and Security: What You Need to Know

conbody.p: Telehealth is an exciting, innovative field that is bringing faster, more accurate care to more places than ever before. But with telehealth and the internet comes a risk of information being compromised. That's the nature of the internet - but we're here to make sure you are safe, healthy, and happy.

Like any website, there is a risk of information being hacked or accessed. At virtuwell, we take your security very seriously and make it a critical part of our mission to keep it safe. You can view our Privacy Policy by going to virtuwell.com and scrolling to the bottom of the screen.

With Gwen, we don't actually need any of your personal information - so there's no need to enter it. But, if you do, we automatically remove it from our caches and databases using a tagging system. When it's tagged, we go in and delete any personal health information (PHI). We keep the great questions you ask - but none of it is traceable to you, your IP address, or location.

The only thing we keep from your conversation is the information you want us to keep. When you exit Gwen, you have the option to "submit chat." When you do, your questions (minus the PHI) are submitted, tagged, and added to her knowledge base. The knowledge base is regularly monitored by our team, so the answers are as accurate as possible. If you don't want to share your chat with Gwen's database, simple say "no" or exit out of the bot. Done! Nothing is saved locally or externally.
Of course, if you have questions, give us a call at 1-877-440-1001 or email us at experience@virtuwell.com. We're here 24/7/365 for you.
